Victoria Anna Herman (Polish Anna Wiktoria German; February 14, 1936 , Urgench, Uzbek SSR , Soviet Union - August 25, 1982 , Warsaw, Poland) - Polish singer and composer , opera and pop star of the 1960s - early 1980s , known primarily as a singer of pop songs in different languages Ã¢â‚¬â€¹Ã¢â‚¬â€¹of the world, primarily in Polish and Russian .
She wrote songs for Soviet songwriter Arno Babajanyan , Eugene Ptichkin , Alexandra Pakhmutova , Yan Frenkel , Oscar Feltsman Vladimir Shainski and others. The most well known for her performance of the song " Hope" (music Pahmutowa on the next. N. Dobronravova ) , "When blooming gardens ", " Echoes of Love ", "Accident ", " Shine, shine , my star ." Songs performed by Anna Herman differed great warmth, sincerity , melodiousness and melody .
Anna was very popular among fans of lyrical songs in the Soviet Union 1970-1980 -ies. The firm "Melody" was released five of its long-running records, the first of which was released in October 1968 and is today a collector's rarity filofonicheskim .
Anna German voice - powerful lyric coloratura soprano unusual , transparent , high voice. The unique style of performance impresses unbounded upper vocal register. Singer differed great musicality , artistry , great warmth and sincerity of the song created image.
